alert.note: Alert for Coastal Calhoun (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Wind Chill Watch issued January 15 at 2:37AM CST until January 17 at 10:00AM CST by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM TO 11 PM CST THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 11 AM CST TUESDAY... ...WIND CHILL WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the first Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 15 degrees. For the Winter Weather Advisory, freezing rain. Additional ice accumulations of a light glaze. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 15 degrees. For the second Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 5 above zero. For the Wind Chill Watch, dangerously cold wind chills possible. Wind chills as low as 15 degrees. * WHERE...Coastal Calhoun. * WHEN...For the first Wind Chill Warning, until noon CST today. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 3 PM CST this afternoon. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 6 PM to 11 PM CST this evening. For the second Wind Chill Warning, from 11 PM this evening to 11 AM CST Tuesday. For the Wind Chill Watch, from Tuesday evening through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Very slippery sidewalks, roads and bridges are possible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The dangerously cold wind chills could result in hypothermia or frostbite if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. Prepare for possible power outages. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
